bill_title: provide that certain minors in the custody of the Department of Corrections be segregated from others.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide that certain minors in the custody of the Department of Corrections be segregated from others. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 26-8B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: While in the custody of the Department of Corrections, no child in need of supervision, as defined in § 26-8B-2, may be placed in any facility, program, locality, or environment which causes or is likely to cause the child in need of supervision to be in either direct physical contact or prolonged physical proximity to any delinquent child, as defined in § 26-8C-2. The provisions of this Act do not prohibit the Department of Corrections from placing children in need of supervision in any facility or from requiring children in need of supervision to participate in any program, if the placement or participation can be facilitated without any contact with delinquent children. Section 2. That chapter 26-8B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The term, direct physical contact or prolonged physical proximity, as used in this Act, does not refer to accidental contact, minimal incidental contact, or visual contact from a distance sufficient to preclude any likelihood of direct physical contact.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide that certain minors in the custody of the Department of Corrections be segregated from others. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 26-8B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: While in the physical custody of the Department of Corrections, no child in need of supervision, as defined in § 26-8B-2, may be placed in any facility, program, locality, or environment which causes or is likely to cause the child in need of supervision to be in either direct physical contact or prolonged physical proximity to any delinquent child, as defined in § 26-8C-2. The provisions of this Act do not prohibit the Department of Corrections from placing children in need of supervision in any facility or from requiring children in need of supervision to participate in any program, if the placement or participation can be facilitated without any contact with delinquent children. The provisions of this Act do not apply to children in need of supervision while in any mental health program, chemical dependency treatment program, or private sector placement. Section 2. That chapter 26-8B be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The term, direct physical contact or prolonged physical proximity, as used in this Act, does not refer to accidental contact, minimal incidental contact, or visual contact from a distance sufficient to preclude any likelihood of direct physical contact. BILL HISTORY 1/18/00 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 75 1/21/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/21/00 Deferred by Chair. 1/28/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/2/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/2/00 Deferred by Chair. 2/4/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/00 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 4, NAYS 3. S.J. 327
